content.question: A particle moves along the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis with velocity given by <math alttext="v of t, equals, 4, t, minus, 20 times the sine of, open parenthesis, t squared, plus 1, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>v</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>20</mn><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> for time <math alttext="t greater than or equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. If the particle is at position <math alttext="x equals pi" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>π</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> at time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, which of the following gives the position of the particle at time <math alttext="t equals 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 4, of, open parenthesis, 4, t, minus, 20 times the sine of, open parenthesis, t squared, plus 1, close parenthesis, close parenthesis, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>20</mn><mi>sin</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="pi plus, the integral from, 0 to 4, of, open parenthesis, 4, t, minus, 20 times the sine of, open parenthesis, t squared, plus 1, close parenthesis, close parenthesis, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>π</mi><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>20</mn><mi>sin</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the derivative, with respect to t, of, open parenthesis, 4, t, minus, 20 times the sine of, open parenthesis, t squared, plus 1, close parenthesis, close parenthesis, evaluated at t equals 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>20</mn><mi>sin</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>)</mo></mrow><msub><mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 4, of, the absolute value of, 4, t, minus, 20 times the sine of, open parenthesis, t squared, plus 1, close parenthesis, end absolute value, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>|</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>20</mn><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>|</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="pi plus, the integral from, 0 to 4, of, open parenthesis, 4, t, minus, 20 times the sine of, open parenthesis, t squared, plus 1, close parenthesis, close parenthesis, d t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>π</mi><mo>+</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>20</mn><mi>sin</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 8.2: Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration Functions Using Integrals

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
